channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Glass in the shelter is smashed and all over the floor, 20th February
item.description:
Lots of glass everywhere someone on a wheelchair would not be able to pass safely

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenwich South Street, Greater London

item.category: Damage - smashed glass or panels / jagged metal edges on shelter

item.title: Light and car charging point inoperative, 20th February
item.description:
Lamp column and car charger not working. Same at the other charger on old farm road west and the one on Old Farm Avenue
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Old Farm Road West, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog foul left on pavement, 20th February
item.description:
Another large dog foul left on pavement overnight or early morning Please can the problem be attended to and cleaned promptly my toddler nearly trod in it this morning and is public health hazard Think there is a repeat offender in our area- more surveillance or penalty notices needed
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vernham Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Base of street light open, 20th February
item.description:
Cover to street light has been removed and is next to the bins. Electricals of the street light are exposed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Point Hill, Greenwich

item.title: 4' x 4' pothole 50mm deep, 20th February
item.description:
4' x 4' pothole 50mm deep, half way up Shooters Hill Westbound. Traffic is swerving to go around it. Very dangerous for motorcyclists filtering up the line of traffic when cars are suddenly swerving
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shooters Hill, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At least 30 potholes, 20th February

item.title: A mountain of litter next to Charlton bus stop, 20th February
item.description:
Hi there, It's clear that the council does not clean regularly Charlton area, the attached areas full of litter has been like that for weeks. Reported several times here with no action - please address this asap. Best, Lidia

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolwich Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
